H0.text: turkish finnish and hungarian belong to which family of languages. Altaic languages

H1.text: turkish finnish and hungarian belong to which family of languages. Indo-European languages

H2.text: turkish finnish and hungarian belong to which family of languages. Sino-Tibetan languages

H3.text: turkish finnish and hungarian belong to which family of languages. Uralic languages

A4.text: Finno-Ugric and Samoyedic are listed in ISO 639-5 as primary branches of Uralic.

A5.text: Finnish is the most conservative of the Uralic languages presented here, with nearly half the words on the list above identical to their Proto-Uralic reconstructions.
